data.current_summary: Retrieve email statistics by country and state/province.
data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve your email statistics segmented by country and state/province.**

**We only store up to 7 days of email activity in our database.** By default, 500 items will be returned per request via the Advanced Stats API endpoints.

Advanced Stats provide a more in-depth view of your email statistics and the actions taken by your recipients. You can segment these statistics by geographic location, device type, client type, browser, and mailbox provider. For more information about statistics, please see our [User Guide](https://wwww.twilio.com/docs/sendgrid/ui/analytics-and-reporting/stats-overview).
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves email statistics segmented by geographic location (country and state/province). Accepts date range parameters (start_date, end_date) and optional aggregation settings. Returns up to 500 geographic stat records per request, with each record containing metrics for the specified location. Data retention is limited to the previous 7 days. Supports filtering by category and other advanced stat dimensions. Requires authentication via API key.
data.reasoning: The current description lacks clarity on input parameters (date range, aggregation options), output structure (what metrics are returned per location), and data retention implications. Added specific details about expected parameters, response format, data retention window, and authentication requirements to improve AI agent interpretability.

data.current_summary: Retrieve global email statistics
data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve all of your global email statistics between a given date range.**

Parent accounts can see either aggregated stats for the parent account or aggregated stats for a subuser specified in the `on-behalf-of` header. Subuser accounts will see only their own stats.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves aggregated global email statistics for a specified date range. Accepts start_date and end_date parameters to define the reporting period. Parent accounts can retrieve either their own aggregated statistics or a subuser's statistics via the `on-behalf-of` header; subuser accounts can only retrieve their own statistics. Returns global metrics including sends, bounces, opens, clicks, and other engagement data. Supports optional aggregation by day, week, or month. Requires authentication via API key.
data.reasoning: The current description mentions date range and account hierarchy but lacks clarity on specific input parameters, output metrics, and aggregation options. data.current_summary: Retrieve stats by a specific client type.
data.current_description:

- phone
- tablet
- webmail
- desktop

Advanced Stats provide a more in-depth view of your email statistics and the actions taken by your recipients. You can segment these statistics by geographic location, device type, client type, browser, and mailbox provider. For more information about statistics, please see our [Statistics Overview](https://sendgrid.com/docs/ui/analytics-and-reporting/stats-overview/).
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves email statistics for a specific client type (phone, tablet, webmail, or desktop). Requires the client_type path parameter. Returns up to 500 items per request by default. Data retention is limited to 7 days of email activity. Supports filtering by date range and aggregation parameters. Response includes engagement metrics (opens, clicks, bounces, etc.) for the specified client type. Use query parameters to customize the date range, aggregation period, and result limit.
data.reasoning: Description lists available client types but lacks clarity on the required path parameter and query parameters for filtering. Enhanced to clarify the required client_type parameter and available query options for better AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'ListDeviceStat' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Description includes helpful device type table but lacks clarity on query parameters for filtering and customization. Simplified description to focus on key inputs and outputs while maintaining device type context for AI agent interpretability.

data.current_summary: Retrieve email statistics by device type.
data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve your email statistics segmented by the device type.**

**We only store up to 7 days of email activity in our database.** By default, 500 items will be returned per request via the Advanced Stats API endpoints.

## Available Device Types
| **Device** | **Description** | **Example** |
|---|---|---|
| Desktop | Email software on desktop computer. | I.E., Outlook, Sparrow, or Apple Mail. |
| Webmail |	A web-based email client. | I.E., Yahoo, Google, AOL, or Outlook.com. |
| Phone | A smart phone. | iPhone, Android, Blackberry, etc.
| Tablet | A tablet computer. | iPad, android based tablet, etc. |
| Other | An unrecognized device. |

Advanced Stats provide a more in-depth view of your email statistics and the actions taken by your recipients. You can segment these statistics by geographic location, device type, client type, browser, and mailbox provider. For more information about statistics, please see our [Statistics Overview](https://sendgrid.com/docs/ui/analytics-and-reporting/stats-overview/).
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves email statistics segmented by device type (desktop, webmail, phone, tablet, or other). Returns up to 500 items per request by default. Data retention is limited to 7 days of email activity. Supports filtering by date range and aggregation parameters. Response includes engagement metrics grouped by device type. Use query parameters to customize the date range, aggregation period, and result limit.
data.reasoning: Description includes helpful device type table but lacks clarity on query parameters for filtering and customization. Simplified description to focus on key inputs and outputs while maintaining device type context for AI agent interpretability.

data.current_summary: Retrieve email statistics by country and state/province.
data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve your email statistics segmented by country and state/province.**

**We only store up to 7 days of email activity in our database.** By default, 500 items will be returned per request via the Advanced Stats API endpoints.

Advanced Stats provide a more in-depth view of your email statistics and the actions taken by your recipients. You can segment these statistics by geographic location, device type, client type, browser, and mailbox provider. For more information about statistics, please see our [User Guide](https://wwww.twilio.com/docs/sendgrid/ui/analytics-and-reporting/stats-overview).
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves email statistics segmented by geographic location (country and state/province). Accepts date range parameters (start_date, end_date) and optional aggregation settings. Returns up to 500 geographic stat records per request, with each record containing metrics for the specified location. Data retention is limited to the previous 7 days. Supports filtering by category and other advanced stat dimensions. Requires authentication via API key.
data.reasoning: The current description lacks clarity on input parameters (date range, aggregation options), output structure (what metrics are returned per location), and data retention implications. Added specific details about expected parameters, response format, data retention window, and authentication requirements to improve AI agent interpretability.

Returns up to 500 mailbox provider stat records per request, with each record containing engagement metrics (opens, clicks, bounces, etc.) for the specified provider. data.current_summary: Retrieve global email statistics
data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve all of your global email statistics between a given date range.**

Parent accounts can see either aggregated stats for the parent account or aggregated stats for a subuser specified in the `on-behalf-of` header. Subuser accounts will see only their own stats.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves aggregated global email statistics for a specified date range. Accepts start_date and end_date parameters to define the reporting period. Parent accounts can retrieve either their own aggregated statistics or a subuser's statistics via the `on-behalf-of` header; subuser accounts can only retrieve their own statistics. Returns global stat metrics including sends, bounces, opens, clicks, and other engagement data. Supports optional aggregation by day, week, or month. Requires authentication via API key.
data.reasoning: The current description mentions date range and account hierarchy but lacks clarity on specific input parameters, output metrics, and aggregation options. Improved description to explicitly detail expected parameters (start_date, end_date), account access patterns, response content (specific metrics returned), aggregation capabilities, and authentication requirements for clearer AI agent interpretation.

data.current_summary: Retrieve email statistics by client type.
data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve your email statistics segmented by client type.**

**We only store up to 7 days of email activity in our database.** By default, 500 items will be returned per request via the Advanced Stats API endpoints.

Advanced Stats provide a more in-depth view of your email statistics and the actions taken by your recipients. You can segment these statistics by geographic location, device type, client type, browser, and mailbox provider. For more information about statistics, please see our [Statistics Overview](https://sendgrid.com/docs/ui/analytics-and-reporting/stats-overview/).
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves email statistics segmented by client type (phone, tablet, webmail, desktop). Returns up to 500 items per request by default. Data retention is limited to 7 days of email activity. Supports filtering by date range and aggregation parameters. Response includes engagement metrics grouped by client type. Use query parameters to customize the date range, aggregation period, and result limit.
data.reasoning: Description lacks specifics on available client types and expected query parameters. Added list of client types and clarified parameter usage to improve AI agent interpretability and decision-making.

message: Operation 'GetClientStat' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Description lists available client types but lacks clarity on the required path parameter and query parameters for filtering. Enhanced to clarify the required client_type parameter and available query options for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_summary: Retrieve stats by a specific client type.
data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve your email statistics segmented by a specific client type.**

**We only store up to 7 days of email activity in our database.** By default, 500 items will be returned per request via the Advanced Stats API endpoints.

### Available Client Types
- phone
- tablet
- webmail
- desktop

Advanced Stats provide a more in-depth view of your email statistics and the actions taken by your recipients. You can segment these statistics by geographic location, device type, client type, browser, and mailbox provider. For more information about statistics, please see our [Statistics Overview](https://sendgrid.com/docs/ui/analytics-and-reporting/stats-overview/).
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves email statistics for a specific client type (phone, tablet, webmail, or desktop). Requires the client_type path parameter. Returns up to 500 items per request by default. Data retention is limited to 7 days of email activity. Supports filtering by date range and aggregation parameters. Response includes engagement metrics (opens, clicks, bounces, etc.) for the specified client type. Use query parameters to customize the date range, aggregation period, and result limit.
data.reasoning: Description lists available client types but lacks clarity on the required path parameter and query parameters for filtering. Enhanced to clarify the required client_type parameter and available query options for better AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'ListDeviceStat' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Description includes helpful device type table but lacks clarity on query parameters for filtering and customization. Simplified description to focus on key inputs and outputs while maintaining device type context for AI agent interpretability.

data.current_summary: Retrieve email statistics by device type.
data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve your email statistics segmented by the device type.**

**We only store up to 7 days of email activity in our database.** By default, 500 items will be returned per request via the Advanced Stats API endpoints.

## Available Device Types
| **Device** | **Description** | **Example** |
|---|---|---|
| Desktop | Email software on desktop computer. | I.E., Outlook, Sparrow, or Apple Mail. |
| Webmail |	A web-based email client. | I.E., Yahoo, Google, AOL, or Outlook.com. |
| Phone | A smart phone. | iPhone, Android, Blackberry, etc.
| Tablet | A tablet computer. | iPad, android based tablet, etc. |
| Other | An unrecognized device. |

Advanced Stats provide a more in-depth view of your email statistics and the actions taken by your recipients. You can segment these statistics by geographic location, device type, client type, browser, and mailbox provider. For more information about statistics, please see our [Statistics Overview](https://sendgrid.com/docs/ui/analytics-and-reporting/stats-overview/).
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves email statistics segmented by device type (desktop, webmail, phone, tablet, or other). Returns up to 500 items per request by default. Data retention is limited to 7 days of email activity. Supports filtering by date range and aggregation parameters. Response includes engagement metrics grouped by device type. Use query parameters to customize the date range, aggregation period, and result limit.
data.reasoning: Description includes helpful device type table but lacks clarity on query parameters for filtering and customization. Simplified description to focus on key inputs and outputs while maintaining device type context for AI agent interpretability.

data.current_summary: Retrieve email statistics by country and state/province.
data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve your email statistics segmented by country and state/province.**

**We only store up to 7 days of email activity in our database.** By default, 500 items will be returned per request via the Advanced Stats API endpoints.

Advanced Stats provide a more in-depth view of your email statistics and the actions taken by your recipients. You can segment these statistics by geographic location, device type, client type, browser, and mailbox provider. For more information about statistics, please see our [User Guide](https://wwww.twilio.com/docs/sendgrid/ui/analytics-and-reporting/stats-overview).
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves email statistics segmented by geographic location (country and state/province). Accepts date range parameters (start_date, end_date) and optional aggregation settings. Returns up to 500 geographic stat records per request, with each record containing metrics for the specified location. Data retention is limited to the previous 7 days. Supports filtering by category and other advanced stat dimensions. Requires authentication via API key.
data.reasoning: The current description lacks clarity on input parameters (date range, aggregation options), output structure (what metrics are returned per location), and data retention implications. Added specific details about expected parameters, response format, data retention window, and authentication requirements to improve AI agent interpretability.

**We only store up to 7 days of email activity in our database.** By default, 500 items will be returned per request via the Advanced Stats API endpoints.

Advanced Stats provide a more in-depth view of your email statistics and the actions taken by your recipients. You can segment these statistics by geographic location, device type, client type, browser, and mailbox provider. For more information about statistics, please see our [Statistics Overview](https://sendgrid.com/docs/ui/analytics-and-reporting/stats-overview/).

Accepts date range parameters (start_date, end_date) and optional aggregation settings. Returns up to 500 mailbox provider stat records per request, with each record containing engagement metrics (opens, clicks, bounces, etc.) for the specified provider. Data retention is limited to the previous 7 days. Supports filtering by category and other advanced stat dimensions. Requires authentication via API key.

data.current_summary: Retrieve global email statistics
data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve all of your global email statistics between a given date range.**

Parent accounts can see either aggregated stats for the parent account or aggregated stats for a subuser specified in the `on-behalf-of` header. Subuser accounts will see only their own stats.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves aggregated global email statistics for a specified date range. Accepts start_date and end_date parameters to define the reporting period. Parent accounts can retrieve either their own aggregated statistics or a subuser's statistics via the `on-behalf-of` header; subuser accounts can only retrieve their own statistics. Returns global stat metrics including sends, bounces, opens, clicks, and other engagement data. Supports optional aggregation by day, week, or month. Requires authentication via API key.
data.reasoning: The current description mentions date range and account hierarchy but lacks clarity on specific input parameters, output metrics, and aggregation options. Improved description to explicitly detail expected parameters (start_date, end_date), account access patterns, response content (specific metrics returned), aggregation capabilities, and authentication requirements for clearer AI agent interpretation.
